pros: This is an excellent place to work
cons: I dont beleive there are any negatives

job_title: Student Library Assistant in Hillsboro, MO
pros: Worked around my academic schedule, really nice in summer with projects to stay busy still, very calm environment
cons: Sometimes tedious work, sometimes lonely at night when there are not many people
Not enough vacation or time off

job_title: Adjunct Voice Teacher in Hillsboro, IL
pros: Big personalities in the dept, but very talented kids!
cons: Kids don’t know how to practice or be responsible.
There are no cons at this institution.

pros: Flexible schedule, generous leave, great professionalism.
cons: Could provide better training for adjuncts.

pros:
-Make your own schedule
-Choose which topics to Tutor
-You will still be paid for registering students hours, even if they don't show up
cons:
-Some people are usually not prepared, so know broadly about the subject
-People will ask you to do their assignment

pros: I loved working with the children as well as working with the lead teachers. Everyone was very helpful when I was not sure of something they were will to help teach me or if I need to do something differently they gave great advice on how to do something. All around it was a good environment to work in.
cons: I don't have anything bad to say.

pros: The college was a great place to work.  The employees are, for the most part, dedicated and serious about making it a better place. They are also very friendly.  Some of the instructors are typically arrogant and snobbish, but many are really very nice. State retirement plan is a good one.
cons: Older school so there is a lot of upgrading needed.  Capital funds are there for the work to be done, but there is a lot to do.  BOT's is a connected local group of "good old boys" so while outsiders are hired, it can sometimes be difficult to get things done. Also, health insurance could use an upgrade.

review_title: From the Adjunct Point of View
pros: I have a great amount of freedom in how I run my courses.  Department and Division Chairs are fairly hands-off when it comes to my instruction.  They have always been fairly flexible with my schedule, too.
cons: The college itself seems a bit stuck in the past.  They are resistant to examining their own policies, and tend to do things because "that's just how it's always been done."  Progressive change is hard to come by.

review_title: Jefferson College is a very student oriented, team focused institution willing to embrace innovation and technology.
pros: While the environment is student focused, the collaboration of staff and faculty work towards best practices to ensure support and progression for all.
cons: As positive as the experience has been, there continues a heirarchy that many perceive as a barrier.

job_title: Switchboard Operator/Office Assistant in Greenbrier, AR
pros: I loved working at Jeffco as a student worker or a part time employee.  I would highly suggest this company to anyone!
cons: There are absolutely no cons to this company!!!

pros:
Coworkers, people. Team effort. Everyone helps one another. I had amazing supervisors.
Benefits are great, paid schooling for employees and their children.
cons: Room for advancement. I worked there many years. Once you are in a full-time position, your locked in. Being a single parent I had to work a part time job to make ends meet. Retirement plan outdated.

pros: A great place for the students.
cons: More full time professors needed.  Too many adjunct instructors for the amount of full time Instructors.  Without full time instructors there is no one to take ownership of the long term goals of the programs.

pros: The time off, 4 weeks vacation, and retirement plan greatly offset the below industry standard pay.
cons: Being in education the pay is lower than private industry.

pros: Fun, you work with others, had clear directions on what to do, and was simply a good experience overall.
cons: None that I can think of.

pros:
Medium workplace
Great people that love students
